bibl.title: Aretalogies.
bibl.note: Attempts to trace the Egyptian share in the formation of Hellenistic aretalogy, concentrating specifically on the role of cult practice in this process. - Different Views. - The Evidence [in part., four hymns of Isidoros inscribed on two pillars of the ancient sanctuary of Narmouthis (I. métriques 175)]. - The Context. - Attempts at Categorisation. - Mediation between Egypt and Greece or the Question of Agency. - Archaic Sequences, Modern Tales.

bibl.title: Shifting Social Imaginaries in the Hellenistic Period. Narrations, Practices, and Images

bibl.seg: Eftychia Stavrianopoulou (ed.), Shifting Social Imaginaries in the Hellenistic Period. Narrations, Practices, and Images = Mnemosyne. Supplementum 363 (Leiden, 2013) pp. 143-176.

Attempts to trace the Egyptian share in the formation of Hellenistic aretalogy, concentrating specifically on the role of cult practice in this process. - Different Views. - The Evidence [in part., four hymns of Isidoros inscribed on two pillars of the ancient sanctuary of Narmouthis (I. métriques 175)]. - The Context. - Attempts at Categorisation. - Mediation between Egypt and Greece or the Question of Agency. - Archaic Sequences, Modern Tales.
